title: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan Accused Of Bullying Reporter At Question Time | 10 News
description: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan has faced scrutiny in Question Time after being accused of ‚Äúbullying‚Äù a journalist during a fiery CFMEU press conference.  Opposition MPs questioned her decision to halt the media appearance until 10 News Melbourne reporter Jessica Maggio retracted a comment that she appeared ‚Äúdisinterested‚Äù.  Ms Allan defended her actions, saying she would not accept what she described as a false characterisation of her conduct.  The political standoff has fuelled renewed calls for a Royal Commission into CFMEU corruption.   Labor MPs rejected the opposition‚Äôs proposal, despite it being backed by every non-Labor member in the upper house. title: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan Hits Back After Scrutiny Over CFMEU Corruption Scandal | 10 News
description: Premier Jacinta Allan has hit back at suggestions she's uninterested in allegations that victims of union corruption in the construction industry are too scared to report their experiences. title: Bayer Offers $7.25 Billion To Settle Cancer Claims | 10 News
description: German drug giant Bayer has offered to pay US$7.25 billion to settle numerous lawsuits claiming its weedkiller Roundup caused cancer.  The product was a popular staple in households since the 1970s, but was identified as a probable human carcinogen by the World Health Organization in 2015.  10‚Äôs Late News explains.
